'''Carl Franklin Hostetter''' ([[6 August|August 6]], [[1965]]) is a [[wikipedia:NASA|NASA]] computer scientist and [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] scholar who is a key figure of the [[Elvish Linguistic Fellowship]].
==Principal writing and editing==
Hostetter is the author of numerous articles on [[Languages|Tolkienian linguistics]], and the editor of two journals on the subject, ''[[Vinyar Tengwar]]'' (print) and ''[[Tengwestië (journal)|Tengwestië]]'' (online).

Together with [[Christopher Gilson]], [[Arden R. Smith]], [[Bill Welden]], and [[Patrick H. Wynne]] (called by some the "[[Elfconner]]s"), he has been engaged by [[Christopher Tolkien]] in the ordering, editing, and publishing of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s writings concerning his invented languages, which have been published as ''[[Parma Eldalamberon]]'' numbers 11 through 22 (and continuing) and in ''Vinyar Tengwar''.

Hostetter edited ''[[The Nature of Middle-earth]]'', which includes unpublished writings by Tolkien, as well as writings originally published in ''Vinyar Tengwar'' and ''[[La Feuille de la Compagnie 3]]''.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://tolkienista.com/2021/07/16/from-linguistics-to-metaphysics-interview-with-carl-f-hostetter-editor-of-the-new-book-by-j-r-r-tolkien/|articlename=From Linguistics to Metaphysics: interview with Carl F. Hostetter, editor of the new book by J.R.R. Tolkien|dated=16 July 2021|website=Tolkienista|accessed=6 September 2021}}</ref> 
==Mailing-lists==
Hostetter has also contributed to various mailing-lists dedicated to Tolkien's languages, including [[Tolklang]] and [[Elfling]]. After a (still ongoing) dispute with [[David Salo]] and [[Helge Fauskanger]],{{Citation needed}} he set up [[Lambengolmor (mailing list)|Lambengolmor]] and Elfling-d.
==Online presence==
Hostetter posts online ([https://www.instagram.com/aelfwine/ instagram], [https://thehalloffire.net/forum/ TheHallOfFire.net], [https://www.tolkienguide.com/profile/247 TolkienGuide], etc.) under the username [[Aelfwine]].
